title: ISO 37301:2021 - Principles of Compliance Management Systems
headline: Learn the fundamentals of compliance management systems based on ISO 37301:2021 requirements in this free online course.
description: This compliance management course will familiarize you with the latest compliance management systems standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). You will learn the basic elements of compliance management systems by understanding the requirements of ISO 37301:2021. In addition, this course will guide you through establishing, implementing, maintaining, and continually improving a compliance management system.
courseDescription:
This ISO 37301:2021 course provides an understanding of the requirements for establishing a compliance management system within an organization. You will become knowledgeable about the concept of compliance management systems and the benefits that such a system may provide to a business. We cover how an organization may continually improve its compliance performance through the "Plan-Do-Check-Act" approach specified in ISO 37301:2021. You will also understand the terminologies used in ISO 37301:2021, as well as its harmonized structure, which is adopted by all the latest ISO standards.

The course will explain the requirements for understanding an organization's context to develop its compliance objectives. You will learn about top management's roles and responsibilities within the compliance management domain. In addition, we discuss the planning and support requirements for establishing a reliable compliance management system. You will understand the need for operational controls, essential in managing compliance risks during business operations. The course will also discuss how an organization can evaluate and improve its compliance performance.

The consequences of noncompliance can be catastrophic for businesses. Therefore, it is essential to have a reliable compliance management system. This course will help you develop the necessary knowledge and understanding to support your organization in effectively planning, implementing, managing, monitoring, and maintaining a reliable compliance management system. It is most valuable for managers, consultants, and compliance officers seeking a comprehensive understanding of ISO 37301 requirements for a compliance management system. Those who aspire to work as compliance officers or consultants can also benefit. So enroll today and educate yourself with the world's most widely accepted compliance management systems standard.

  • Lesson Summary

    • A compliance management system (CMS) is a framework that incorporates necessary structures, policies, processes, and procedures to achieve the desired compliance objectives and to take action to avoid, detect, and respond to non-compliance.
    • ISO 37301:2021 is an internationally accepted standard that provides a comprehensive set of requirements and guidelines for establishing, developing, implementing, evaluating, maintaining, and improving a reliable compliance management system within an organization.
    • There are ten clauses in ISO 37301, with additional subclauses. The first three clauses (1 to 3) are informational and do not specify any requirements. The next seven clauses (4 to 10) are mandatory and describe the ISO 37301 requirements.
    • The requirements for compliance management are divided into four sequential phases: Plan, Do, Check, and Act. This is a cyclical approach to achieving continuous improvement.
    • The requirements of the standard start from clause 4, where the standard asks to identify the internal and external issues, understand the needs and expectations of interested parties, determine the scope of the compliance management system and then develop a compliance management system. There are also requirements for identifying compliance obligations and conducting a compliance risk assessment.
    • In clause 5, ISO 37301:2021 emphasizes the involvement and commitment of leadership. The standard requires them to establish a compliance policy and appoint a compliance function.
